cleaned_text: prescription medicine used with other asthma medicines for the maintenance treatment of moderate-to-severe eosinophilic or oral steroid dependent asthma in adults and children 6 years of age and older whose asthma is not controlled with their current asthma medicines. DUPIXENT helps prevent severe asthma attacks (exacerbations) and can improve your breathing. DUPIXENT may also help reduce the amount of oral corticosteroids you need while preventing severe asthma attacks and improving your breathing. DUPIXENT is not used to treat sudden breathing problems. It is not known if DUPIXENT is safe and effective in children with asthma under 6 years of age. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.MOREDU WITH LESS ASTHMA APPROVED FOR AGES 6 AND UP#1 PRESCRIBED BIOLOGIC BY PULMONOLOGISTS AND ALLERGISTS In an aggregate across all indications. Data on file, Sanofi US. IQVIA weekly NSOB; data through June 2023.THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS THE SIGNS THE BENEFITS3BENEFITS WITHEVERY BREATH Prescribed to over 100,000 asthma patients and counting!1,a,bIMPROVES LUNG FUNCTION SO YOU OR YOUR CHILD CAN BREATHE BETTER IN AS LITTLE AS 2 WEEKS CAN REDUCE OR COMPLETELY ELIMINATE ORAL STEROID USETARGETS A SOURCE OF ASTHMA DRIVEN BY TYPE 2 INFLAMMATION TO HELP IMPROVE SYMPTOMS HELPS PREVENT ASTHMA ATTACKS a LH Patient View; data through June 2023. b New adult and pediatric patients aged 6 years and older with moderate-to- severe eosinophilic or OCS-dependent asthma. DUPIXENT was studied in 4 clinical trials with more than 3,200 people 6 years of age and older with moderate-to-severe asthma. IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Do not use if you are allergic to dupilumab or to any of the ingredients in DUPIXENT®. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS THE SIGNS THE BENEFITS4Scientific advances have found that an underlying inflammation, known as type 2 inflammation may be a source of uncontrolled moderate-to-severe asthma. DUPIXENT blocks two of the key sources of type 2 inflammation in the lungs. This can result in a reduction of asthma symptoms.A FIRST-OF-ITS-KIND ASTHMA TREATMENT DID YOU KNOW 8 OF 10 ASTHMA PATIENTS HAVE TYPE 2 INFLAMMATION? IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Before using DUPIXENT, tell your healthcare provider about all your medical conditions, including if you: have a parasitic (helminth) infection; are scheduled to receive any vaccinations. You should not receive a "live vaccine" right before and during treatment with DUPIXENT. IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Before using DUPIXENT, tell your healthcare provider about all your medical conditions, including if you (cont'd): are pregnant or plan to become pregnant. It is not known whether DUPIXENT will harm your unborn baby. A pregnancy registry for women who take DUPIXENT during pregnancy collects information about the health of you and your baby. To enroll or get more information call 1-877-311-8972 or go to https:/ /mothertobaby.org/ongoing-study/dupixent/. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS THE SIGNS THE BENEFITS7While oral steroids may be helpful when prescribed, there is some medical concern over long-term use of oral steroids, which includes: weight gain diabetes mood change vision problems * In a clinical study of patients 12+ years old with DUPIXENT 300 mg + standard of care (SOC) vs 68% with placebo + SOC. Do not stop taking your corticosteroid medicines unless instructed by your healthcare provider. This may cause other symptoms that were controlled by the corticosteroid medicine to come back.In a study of people dependent on oral corticosteroids:BETTER BREATHING. LESS ORAL STEROIDS. 86%OF PEOPLE ON DUPIXENT REDUCED OR ELIMINATEDTHEIR ORAL STEROID USE* IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Before using DUPIXENT, tell your healthcare provider about all your medical conditions, including if you (cont'd): are breastfeeding or plan to breastfeed. It is not known whether DUPIXENT passes into your breast milk. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS THE SIGNS8People often think their asthma or their child's asthma is under control, but it may not be. There may be signs that you or your child could be doing better. SOME KEY FACTORS THAT MAY INDICATE THAT MODERATE-TO-SEVERE ASTHMA ISN'T WELL-CONTROLLED:DO YOU KNOW THE SIGNS OF CONTROL? A trip to the ER because of asthma occurred at least once in the past yearActivities were limited or missed because of an attackIn the past month, sleep has been interrupted because of asthmaRescue inhaler use is more than twice a week IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Tell your healthcare provider about all the medicines you take, including prescription and over-the-counter medicines, vitamins, and herbal supplements.IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Especially tell your healthcare provider if you are taking oral, topical, or inhaled corticosteroid medicines or use an asthma medicine. Do not change or stop your corticosteroid medicine or other asthma medicine without talking to your healthcare provider. This may cause other symptoms that were controlled by the corticosteroid medicine or other asthma medicine to come back. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS10DU MORE YOU In clinical studies, people taking DUPIXENT saw a meaningful improvement in their day-to-day lives, which included: The relationship between DUPIXENT and these results were studied but not definitively proven.LESS SHORTNESS OF BREATH LESS WHEEZING NOT WAKING AT NIGHT BEING LESS LIMITED IN THEIR NORMAL ACTIVITIES The most common side effects include injection site reactions, pain in the throat (oropharyngeal pain), and high count of a certain white blood cell (eosinophilia). IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: DUPIXENT can cause serious side effects, including: Allergic reactions. DUPIXENT can cause allergic reactions that can sometimes be severe. Stop using DUPIXENT and tell your healthcare provider or get emergency help right away if you get any of the following signs or symptoms: breathing problems or wheezing, swelling of the face, lips, mouth, tongue, or throat, fainting, dizziness, feeling lightheaded, fast pulse, fever, hives, joint pain, general ill feeling, itching, skin rash, swollen lymph nodes, nausea or vomiting, or cramps in your stomach-area. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: DUPIXENT can cause serious side effects, including (cont'd): Inflammation of your blood vessels. Rarely, this can happen in people with asthma who receive DUPIXENT. This may happen in people who also take a steroid medicine by mouth that is being stopped or the dose is being lowered. It is not known whether this is caused by DUPIXENT. Tell your healthcare provider right away if you have: rash, chest pain, worsening shortness of breath, a feeling of pins and needles or numbness of your arms or legs, or persistent fever. Clinical studies have shown that DUPIXENT can: *In those with high eosinophils (a type of white blood cell). The annual rate of severe asthma attacks was 0.20 with DUPIXENT 300 mg vs 1.04 with placebo.HELP SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE LUNG FUNCTION HELP PREVENT SEVERE ASTHMA ATTACKSDU LESS ASTHMA 81%FEWERASTHMA ATTACKS *EXPERIENCED UP TO IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: DUPIXENT can cause serious side effects, including (cont'd): Joint aches and pain. Some people who use DUPIXENT have had trouble walking or moving due to their joint symptoms, and in some cases needed to be hospitalized. Tell your healthcare provider about any new or worsening joint symptoms. Your healthcare provider may stop DUPIXENT if you develop joint symptoms. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.ADULTS (AGES 12+) 13THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS14And with less asthma, they can. DUPIXENT is proven to improve lung function and help prevent asthma attacks in children 6-11 years of age.YOUR CHILD DESERVES TO DU MORE TOO * The annual rate of severe asthma attacks was 0.24 with DUPIXENT 100/200 mg vs 0.67 with placebo. Do not stop taking your corticosteroid medicines unless instructed by your healthcare provider. This may cause other symptoms that were controlled by the corticosteroid medicine to come back.65%FEWER ASTHMA ATTACKSIN CHILDREN * 66%REDUCTION IN STEROIDBURSTS IN CHILDREN IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: The most common side effects in patients with asthma include injection site reactions, high count of a certain white blood cell (eosinophilia), pain in the throat (oropharyngeal pain), and parasitic (helminth) infections. Tell your healthcare provider if you have any side effect that bothers you or that does not go away. These are not all the possible side effects of DUPIXENT. Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You are encouraged to report negative side effects of prescription drugs to the FDA. Visit www.fda.gov/ medwatch, or call 1-800-FDA-1088. Please see additional Important Safety Information throughout and accompanying full Prescribing Information including Patient Information.CHILDREN (AGES 6-11)THE NEXT STEPS TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR THE RESULTS16 Tim DUPIXENT MyWay Patient ambassador Pamela DUPIXENT MyWay Patient ambassadorREAL EXPERIENCES FROM REAL PEOPLE When I was first diagnosed with asthma I was 23 years old. I had no previous symptoms, no family history, and I just started wheezing and coughing. Since I've started using DUPIXENT, I'm able to do more things that I love, like playing with my grandchildren. I have been living with severe asthma for ten years. My symptoms and the coughing would bring on an asthma attack. DUPIXENT has worked for me. It helps me breathe.I'm an outdoors guy. But I couldn't always be as active as I wanted to be. I was constantly worried about my asthma. Now, I'm able to DU MORE of the things I like to do. I'm chasing rainbow trout in the mountains. I'm feeding cattle on the farm.Marlena DUPIXENT MyWay® Patient ambassador Individual results may vary. 17Hearing from people who have had a similar experience can help. To hear more stories of how DUPIXENT has helped others, click here . Join one of our webinars where you can learn from healthcare professionals and patients who know what you're going through. Visit DUPIXENT.com/as-webinars to see what may be available. IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Use DUPIXENT exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. It's an injection given under the skin (subcutaneous injection). Your healthcare provider will decide if you or your caregiver can inject DUPIXENT. Do not try to prepare and inject DUPIXENT until you or your caregiver have been trained by your healthcare provider. In children 12 years of age and older, it's recommended DUPIXENT be administered by or under supervision of an adult. In children 6 to less than 12 years of age, DUPIXENT should be given by a caregiver. Year(s) Month(s) A HELPFUL GUIDE Other TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR20Your healthcare provider prescribes DUPIXENT, and you enroll into DUPIXENT MyWay.Your healthcare provider is your best resource for information about DUPIXENT and should be your primary point of contact throughout your treatment journey. QUESTIONS ABOUT INJECTING? RESOURCES ARE HERE FOR YOU.YOU BEGIN YOUR JOURNEY. Whether you've received injection training from your healthcare provider but are new to injecting or have questions about taking DUPIXENT, we're with you.HAS YOUR DOCTOR PRESCRIBED DUPIXENT®(dupilumab) ? Your healthcare provider can download the enrollment form on DUPIXENT.com , help you fill it out, and fax it back to DUPIXENT MyWay at 1-844-387-9370 You or your healthcare provider can call 1-844-DUPIXEN(T) Option 1 Providing your email address allows DUPIXENT MyWay to give you more support resources about DUPIXENT Take advantage of our supplemental injection resources and training videos by scanning the QR code or clicking here . 21WHAT CAN DUPIXENT MyWay® DO FOR YOU? Enrolling MyWay can help ensure you receive DUPIXENT (dupilumab) as quickly as possible and receive additional support along your treatment journey. For eligible patients, DUPIXENT MyWay can: Explain how to properly store DUPIXENT when you receive your shipment Connect you with a Nurse Educator to answer questions about DUPIXENT and help you start and stay on track with therapy Help research and explain your insurance benefits Find ways to help with the out-of-pocket cost of DUPIXENT if you need help with your copay, you are denied coverage from your health plan, or you do not have or experience a loss in insurance Connect you with your specialty pharmacy to make sure your prescription is shipped to your home or preferred location Provide supplemental injection training—in person, virtually, or over the phone—to help you or a caregiver get more familiar with injecting DUPIXENT Offer a needle disposing kit or sharps container for proper disposal Remind you when it is time to refill your DUPIXENT prescription THE NEXT STEPS22NEED HELP PAYING? $0* COPAY MAY BE AVAILABLE Eligible patients covered by commercial health insurance may pay as little as $0* copay per fill of DUPIXENT (maximum benefit of $13,000 per patient per calendar year). Not eligible? DUPIXENT MyWay may be able to provide additional financial assistance. YOU ARE NOT ELIGIBLE IF YOU: Have government insurance—Medicaid, Medicare, Veterans Affairs, Department of Defense, TRICARE, other federal or state programsYOU MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR THE COPAY CARD PROGRAM IF YOU: Have commercial insurance Have a DUPIXENT prescription for an FDA-approved condition Are a resident of the 50 United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, Guam, or the US Virgin Islands; and are a patient or caregiver aged 18 years or older* Approval is not guaranteed. Program has an annual maximum of $13,000. THIS IS NOT INSURANCE . Not valid for prescriptions paid, in whole or in part, by Medicaid, Medicare, VA, DOD, TRICARE, or other federal or state programs including any state pharmaceutical assistance programs. This program is not valid where prohibited by law, taxed or restricted. DUPIXENT MyWay reserves the right to rescind, revoke, terminate, or amend this offer, eligibility, and terms of use at any time without notice. Any savings provided by the program may vary depending on patients' out-of-pocket costs. The program is intended to help patients afford DUPIXENT. Patients may have insurance plans that attempt to dilute the impact of the assistance available under the program. In those situations, the program may change its terms. Additional terms and conditions apply. THE NEXT STEPS SUPPORT YOU DESERVE ACCESSING COPAY SAVINGS Eligible patients can access Copay Card benefits in 2 ways: Call 1-800-DUPIXENT to ensure Copay benefits are applied to your script. Visit DUPIXENT.com. Here you can apply for a card online. Once approved, provide the Copay Card numbers on your card to the specialty pharmacy when they call you to set up delivery of DUPIXENT. The pharmacy will apply the card to reduce your out-of-pocket costs and will note the card number in your record for future refills. HAVE YOU ALREADY PAID OUT-OF-POCKET COSTS FOR DUPIXENT? You may be eligible for reimbursement of your out-of-pocket expenses if you meet program eligibility requirements and: You were enrolled in the Copay Card Program but did not use it when you filled your DUPIXENT prescription You paid a copay for DUPIXENT before enrolling into the Copay Card Program Your health plan did not accept your Copay Card TO APPLY FOR REIMBURSEMENT: Visit www.patientrebateonline.com to submit for reimbursement of out-of-pocket costs or to check the card balance. You will be asked to register and login Be sure to have ready: - Your prescription insurance card - Prescription label - Your prescription receipt Please allow 7-10 days to process your request. Go to DUPIXENT.com/asthma for full program information.The DUPIXENT MyWay® Copay Card may help eligible patients cover the out-of-pocket cost of DUPIXENT. 23Health information contained herein is provided for general educational purposes only.
